data.title: Madera Burger and Enchilada Suizas
data.text:
I have always enjoyed the pupusas at the Maya, but today we felt like having a burger.  The Madera Burger was big enough to feed two of us!  It had avocado, bacon, mushrooms, tomatoes, lettuce...just about everything you'd ever want on a burger.
My favorite item on the menu is Enchiladas Suizas.  Breaded tri tip on the inside, delicious cheese sauce on the outside.

data.title: Wonderful Food
data.text: Maya has wonderful South American cuisine. It does not get very busy and I am fearful it may close. Parking is behind the restaurant.

data.title: Great Little Find
data.text: On a recent trip north on Hwy 99 we decided to stop in Madera for lunch.  Looked up restaurants on GPS and by chance choose the Maya Grill and Cafe.  What a great find.  It looks kind of small from the street, but the building is long so it's bigger than it appears.  It's very clean and inviting.  The host/server and cook, who came to our table before we left to visit and see how we liked the food, were warm and friendly.  And the food was really good.  This is a Mexican & Salvadorian grill.  They have offer all the familiar Mexican choices, but we decided to try the Salvadorian pupusas which are little masa cakes stuffed with six different fillings.  A standard order allows you to choose three with any of the six fillings.  All the fillings are cheese based.  Three by the way are plenty.  They were tasty, and filling.  Oh and the aqua fresco was amazing and by itself worth stopping in for.  If you live in the area or just driving by give this little grill a try.  It could become a favorite.

data.title: Loving Pupusas!!!
data.text: 3 Pupusas for $6.99!! Can't beat it!  Plus they are soo good!!! Live music, great service!  Certain days they have live music.  Place is small, but once you go in you realize they are big, building is long and narrow, but arranged well.
